alert.note: Alert for Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. One to two inches of rain have already fallen, and an additional one to one and a half inches of rain is expected to cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pine Grove, Tremont, Tower City, Branchdale, Donaldson, Buck Run, Ravine, Muir, Orwin and Newtown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
